meanings.definition: Enlist: to join a group or organization, especially the military.
meanings.sent1: Tom decided to enlist in the army to serve his country.
meanings.sent2: She will enlist in the navy next month.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to enlist in the dog's pack, thinking it was a military unit.
meanings.sent4: The young artist's paintbrushes enlisted in creating a masterpiece on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The seeds enlisted in growing into beautiful flowers under the warm sun.

meanings.definition: Enlist: to secure the support or help of someone.
meanings.sent1: The teacher asked the students to enlist their parents' help for the school project.
meanings.sent2: He managed to enlist the assistance of his friends in moving to a new apartment.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to enlist the birds' support in finding more nuts for winter.
meanings.sent4: Her smile enlisted the cooperation of her colleagues in completing the task.
meanings.sent5: The music's melody enlisted the audience's attention and applause.

meanings.definition: Enlist: to sign up or recruit for a cause or purpose.
meanings.sent1: The environmental group aims to enlist more volunteers for their beach cleanup.
meanings.sent2: They plan to enlist participants for the charity run next weekend.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to enlist the help of his rabbit in pulling off a trick.
meanings.sent4: Her persuasive speech enlisted many supporters for the community project.
meanings.sent5: The chef's delicious aroma enlisted customers to try the new dish on the menu.
